title: 107_hr2310
content:
The "Military Pay Raise Act of 2001" increases monthly basic pay for uniformed services members effective January 1, 2002, based on pay grade and years of service. Commissioned officers' pay increases based on pay grade and years of service, as outlined in the "Military Pay Raise Act of 2001." Commissioned officers' pay increases based on pay grade and years of service, as outlined in the "Military Pay Raise Act of 2001." The pay percentages for different officer ranks are as follows:
O-6: 7.3%
O-5: 7.3%
O-4: 9.0%
O-3: 8.3%
O-2: 7.3%
O-1: 7.3%
O-10: 7.3% Commissioned officers' pay increases based on pay grade and years of service, as outlined in the "Military Pay Raise Act of 2001." The pay percentages for different officer ranks are as follows:
O-10: 7.3%
O-9: 7.3%
O-8: 7.3%
O-7: 7.3%
O-6: 7.3%
O-5: 7.3%
O-4: 9.0%
O-3: 8.3%
O-2: 7.3%
O-1: 7.3% Commissioned officers' pay increases based on pay grade and years of service, with O-1 to O-5 receiving a 7.3% pay raise across different age brackets. Commissioned officers' pay increases based on pay grade and years of service, with O-1 to O-5 receiving a 7.3% pay raise across different age brackets. Commissioned officers with over 4 years of active duty service as an enlisted member or warrant officer receive pay increases based on pay grade, ranging from 7.3% to 8.3% across different years of service. Commissioned officers with over 4 years of active duty service receive pay increases ranging from 7.3% to 8.3% based on pay grade, across different years of service. Commissioned officers with over 4 years of active duty service receive pay increases ranging from 7.3% to 8.3% based on pay grade. Warrant officers receive pay increases ranging from 7.5% to 8.5% based on pay grade and years of service. Warrant officers receive pay increases ranging from 7.5% to 8.5% based on pay grade and years of service, with specific percentages outlined for different pay grades and years of service. Warrant officers receive pay increases ranging from 7.5% to 8.5% based on pay grade and years of service. Enlisted members receive pay increases ranging from 8.5% to 10.5% based on pay grade and years of service. Enlisted members receive pay increases ranging from 8.5% to 10.5% based on pay grade and years of service, with specific percentages outlined for each pay grade. Enlisted members receive pay increases ranging from 8.5% to 10.5% based on pay grade and years of service, with specific percentages outlined for each pay grade. The pay percentages for each pay grade are as follows: E-8 - 10.0%, E-7 - 9.5%, E-6 - 8.5%, E-5 - 8.5%, E-4 - 7.5%, E-3 - 7.3%, E-2 - 7.3%, E-1 - 7.3%. Enlisted members receive pay increases ranging from 8.5% to 10.5% based on pay grade and years of service. The specific percentages for each pay grade are as follows: E-9 - 10.5%, E-8 - 10.0%, E-7 - 9.5%, E-6 - 8.5%, E-5 - 8.5%, E-4 - 7.5%, E-3 - 7.3%, E-2 - 7.3%. E-2 - 7.3% 7.3% 7.3% 7.3% 7.3% 
E-1 - 7.3% 7.3% 7.3% 7.3% 7.3% The adjustment to monthly basic pay rates for uniformed services members required by section 1009 of title 37, United States Code, will not be made in fiscal year 2002.
